allodb 0.0.0.9004
  • Reference
  • fgeo

Join the main allodb tables: equations``, sitespecies, and sites_info`.

Source: R/master.R
master.Rd

Join the main allodb tables: equations``, sitespecies, and sites_info`.

master(.f = dplyr::full_join)

Arguments

.f

A function, form the dplyr package, used to join tables (e.g. dplyr::full_join()).

Value

A dataframe.

See also

dplyr::full_join().

Other functions to interact with the database: set_type

Examples

# Defaults to use `dplyr::full_join()`
master()
#> # A tibble: 743 x 43
#>    ref_id equation_allome~ equation_id equation_form dependent_varia~
#>    <chr>  <chr>            <chr>       <chr>         <chr>           
#>  1 jenki~ 10^(1.1891+1.41~ 2060ea      10^(a+b*(log~ Total abovegrou~

#>  4 jenki~ 10^(1.2315+1.63~ a4d879      10^(a+b*(log~ Total abovegrou~
#>  5 jenki~ exp(7.217+1.514~ c59e03      exp(a+b*ln(D~ Stem biomass (w~
#>  6 jenki~ exp(7.217+1.514~ c59e03      exp(a+b*ln(D~ Stem biomass (w~
#>  7 jenki~ exp(7.217+1.514~ c59e03      exp(a+b*ln(D~ Stem biomass (w~

#>  9 jenki~ exp(7.217+1.514~ c59e03      exp(a+b*ln(D~ Stem biomass (w~

# But you can use other joins
master(.f = dplyr::left_join)
